artist: Artist: Attributed to Girolamo Siciolante da Sermoneta
description: recto: seated man wearing draping robes with PL elbow resting on a book; balding, with long beard; verso not examined--received framed
medium: Pen and brown ink, heightened with white, on blue laid paper
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, London, October 30, 1980, no. 183, as Circle of Pordenone. [Shaunagh Fitzgerald, London, by 1982]. Sale, Sotheby's, New York, January 16, 1985, no. 275, for $3,850 to Moir; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1985-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Drapery Study (recto); Kneeling Woman (verso)
